explanation: The agent's claim is not correct. The #if / #else is evaluated by the preprocessor: with SIZEOF_INT == 4 and SIZEOF_INT64_T == 8 the #if branch is not part of the translation unit at all (it is removed by preprocessing). MISRA Rule 2.1 concerns unreachable code in the compiled translation units (code that can never execute at run time). Code excluded by the preprocessor is not present in the translation unit and therefore is not an instance of unreachable code under Rule 2.1. (If you want to avoid having alternative branches in source under different build configurations, that is a separate maintainability concern, but it is not a Rule 2.1 violation here.)
